title: QuickOnline premium single-page landing (hero, benefits, pricing, testimonials, contact)

requirements.summary: Build a single-page QuickOnline landing page with Hero, Benefits, Pricing (3 tiers), Testimonials, Contact (buttons + form), and Footer in the required order.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders all required sections in a clear vertical flow on desktop and mobile
Pricing section shows exactly 3 packages/cards
Testimonials section displays at least 3 testimonial entries
Contact section includes WhatsApp button, Call button, and a form with at least Name + Phone/Email + Message fields
Footer includes “QuickOnline © 2026” and a short tagline about helping local businesses grow online

file_operations.description: Create the single-page landing composition that renders sections in order (Hero → Benefits → Pricing → Testimonials → Contact → Footer) and wires all section components together. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) where appropriate for premium layout consistency; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create the Hero section component and export it for use by App. Use shadcn-ui Button for the primary CTA; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create the Benefits section component (premium card/grid layout). Use shadcn-ui Card for benefit items; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Pricing section component that renders exactly 3 package cards with inclusions and per-package CTAs. Use shadcn-ui Card + Button to keep a consistent premium look; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Testimonials section component that renders at least 3 testimonial entries (cards/quotes). Use shadcn-ui Card for testimonial styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Contact section container that includes WhatsApp + Call buttons and the embedded contact form area. Use shadcn-ui Button for action buttons; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Footer component including “QuickOnline © 2026” and a short growth tagline, and ensure it’s used by App. Use shadcn-ui typography primitives if present (or consistent Tailwind classes); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small content/constants module for benefits, pricing tiers (3), and testimonials (>=3) so sections stay clean and consistent.
Ensure the app boots into the new App component and global styles import remains correct (App and index.css).

requirements.summary: Apply a clean white + blue/black premium visual direction with bold typography, soft shadows, subtle animations, and full responsiveness.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary background is white with black/blue accents used consistently for headings, buttons, highlights, and borders
Typography uses bold, modern headings and readable body text with consistent scale
Components (cards, sections, buttons) use subtle shadows and spacing to feel premium
All sections are responsive (no horizontal scroll, readable text, buttons usable on small screens)
Animations are subtle (e.g., hover/fade/slide) and do not block interaction

file_operations.description: Create global Tailwind entry styles (base/components/utilities) and define global design tokens via CSS variables for white background, blue/black accents, typography, radii, and shadow feel. Keep animations subtle and non-blocking.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (if needed) to support the premium spacing/typography/animation utilities used by the landing page while staying within the white + blue/black palette (neutrals allowed).

Apply consistent responsive section spacing, max-width container usage, and subtle motion/hover states across sections. Use shadcn-ui layout-friendly components (e.g., Card) consistently; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure the hero clearly communicates the value proposition for shopkeepers and includes a prominent high-conversion primary CTA above the fold plus a trust element.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero contains a clear headline, short supporting copy, and a high-contrast primary CTA button above the fold on common screen sizes
Primary CTA is visually distinct and includes actionable wording (e.g., “Get Your Website Now”)
Hero includes at least one supporting trust element (e.g., micro-copy, badges, or short proof points) without adding new product features

file_operations.description: Implement hero messaging aimed at shopkeepers (headline + support copy), a visually dominant primary CTA button, and a small trust element (e.g., short proof points/badges). Use shadcn-ui Button to ensure consistent premium CTA styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add/adjust hero copy, CTA label text, and trust micro-copy constants so the value proposition remains consistent across the page.

requirements.summary: Implement pricing section with 3 packages (Basic/Standard/Premium) in a comparison-friendly layout with inclusions and a CTA per package, optionally highlighting a recommended tier.
acceptanceCriteria: Three pricing cards are displayed with package name, price, and bullet list of inclusions
Each package card includes a CTA button
The “recommended”/highlighted package (if used) is visually emphasized consistently with the blue/black accent scheme

file_operations.description: Render exactly three pricing cards (Basic, Standard, Premium) with price + inclusions + CTA per card, using a comparison-friendly responsive grid. Use shadcn-ui Card/Button to maintain consistent premium styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Define the three pricing tiers (names, prices, inclusions, recommended flag, CTA labels) as data consumed by the pricing section.

requirements.summary: Make contact interactions functional: WhatsApp (wa.me) and Call (tel:) links plus a client-validated form with a clear success state (no backend).
acceptanceCriteria: WhatsApp button navigates to a wa.me (or equivalent) URL when clicked
Call button navigates to a tel: URL when clicked
Contact form blocks submission when required fields are empty and shows inline validation feedback
On successful submission, the UI shows a confirmation state/message and clears or preserves fields in a predictable way

file_operations.description: Wire WhatsApp and Call buttons to wa.me and tel: links and embed the contact form. Use shadcn-ui Button for consistent actions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a simple client-side validated form (Name + Phone/Email + Message required) with inline validation feedback and a deterministic success confirmation state after submission. Use shadcn-ui Input/Textarea/Label/Button components for consistent UX; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Establish a cohesive premium theme across layout, spacing, typography, section styling, and buttons using only white/blue/black (plus neutral grays).
acceptanceCriteria: All sections share consistent design tokens (spacing, border radius, shadows, button variants, and heading styles)
The theme feels cohesive across hero, cards, testimonials, and footer (no mixed styles)
No additional dominant accent colors are introduced beyond black/blue/white (minor neutrals like grays are acceptable)

file_operations.description: Refine shared tokens (CSS variables for radii, shadows, foreground/background, primary accent blue) and base typography styles so all sections feel cohesive and premium.

Create a small reusable section wrapper (consistent padding, max-width, optional section heading/subheading styling) to standardize layout across the page. Use shadcn-ui class conventions if applicable; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adopt the shared LandingSection wrapper (or equivalent) across all sections so spacing, headings, and visual rhythm are consistent from hero to footer.

requirements.summary: Add generated brand visuals as static assets and use them in the landing page without backend image serving.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend
Brand visuals appear in the header/hero and/or footer without breaking responsiveness

file_operations.description: Add the generated QuickOnline wordmark logo asset as a static file at the required path for direct frontend use.
Add the generated hero illustration asset as a static file at the required path for direct frontend use.

Reference and render the static hero illustration (frontend/public/assets/generated/quickonline-hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png) and logo (frontend/public/assets/generated/quickonline-logo.dim_512x256.png) in a responsive way within the hero/header area.
Optionally reference the logo (frontend/public/assets/generated/quickonline-logo.dim_512x256.png) in the footer in a way that remains responsive and supports the premium look.
